org.apache.gearpump.streaming.appmaster

Interface TaskScheduler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TaskSchedulerImpl

    public interface TaskScheduler
    Schedules tasks to run for new allocated resources. TaskScheduler only schedule tasks that share the same jar. For scheduling for multiple jars, see JarScheduler.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  TaskScheduler.Location 
      static class  TaskScheduler.Location$ 
      static class  TaskScheduler.TaskStatus 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ResourceRequest[] executorFailed(int executorId)
      This notifies the scheduler that {executorId} is failed, and expect a set of ResourceRequest for all failed tasks on that executor.
      ResourceRequest[] getResourceRequests()
      Get the resource requirements for all unscheduled tasks.
      scala.collection.immutable.List<TaskId> schedule(WorkerId workerId, int executorId, Resource resource)
      This notifies the scheduler that a resource slot on {workerId} and {executorId} is allocated , and expect a task to be scheduled in return.
      scala.collection.immutable.List<TaskId> scheduledTasks(int executorId)
      Queries the task list that already scheduled on the executor
      void setDAG(DAG dag)
      This notify the scheduler that the task DAG is created.

    • Method Detail

      • setDAG

        void setDAG(DAG dag)
        This notify the scheduler that the task DAG is created.
        Parameters:
        dag - task dag

      • getResourceRequests

        ResourceRequest[] getResourceRequests()
        Get the resource requirements for all unscheduled tasks.
        Returns:
        (undocumented)

      • schedule

        scala.collection.immutable.List<TaskId> schedule(WorkerId workerId,
                                                 int executorId,
                                                 Resource resource)
        This notifies the scheduler that a resource slot on {workerId} and {executorId} is allocated , and expect a task to be scheduled in return. Task locality should be considered when deciding whether to offer a task on target {worker} and {executor}

        Parameters:
        workerId - which worker this resource is located.
        executorId - which executorId this resource belongs to.
        resource - (undocumented)
        Returns:
        a list of tasks

      • executorFailed

        ResourceRequest[] executorFailed(int executorId)
        This notifies the scheduler that {executorId} is failed, and expect a set of ResourceRequest for all failed tasks on that executor.

        Parameters:
        executorId - executor that failed
        Returns:
        resource requests of the failed executor

      • scheduledTasks

        scala.collection.immutable.List<TaskId> scheduledTasks(int executorId)
        Queries the task list that already scheduled on the executor

        Parameters:
        executorId - executor to query
        Returns:
        a list of tasks
